CatDescriptText: Lorene Smith, Bedford Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 22, 1958, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that there will be an economic depression in near future like the one in the early thirties?" answer reads: "Yes, I think there will be a depression as severe as that of the '30s. The reason I feel that way is because it just looks like it's coming.  For instance, my husband who works at Westinghouse plant is off one week and working the next."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lorene Smith wearing head scarf and dark coat with scalloped side button closure, holding dark clutch handbag, standing on sidewalk in front of lot with debris, automobiles, and buildings
